thread.title: Celebrity joins fight against lead poisoning in Burlington
thread.title_full: Celebrity joins fight against lead poisoning in Burlington - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: WCAX News
title: Celebrity joins fight against lead poisoning in Burlington
text:
BURLINGTON, Vt. - The fight against lead poisoning got a celebrity boost in Burlington Wednesday night.
Jon Fishman with the band Phish was in the Queen City for a screening of the documentary Mislead: America's Secret Epidemic . Fishman's 2-year-old son got sick from lead poisoning during renovations at their home in Maine. He joined the film's director to talk about having your children tested for potential poisoning and what folks should do to make sure their homes and kids are safe.
"I say to my kids a lot, use your head, don't lose your head and so I have got to practice what I preach, what's the point in panicking, it just makes a bad situation worse. It's not to deny it's a bad situation but you can either freak out or get to work," said Fishman.
"My goal is that somehow in some form, this movie and this movement will touch the lives of every parent in the country, that's the goal," said Tamara Rubin, said Lead Safe America Foundation executive director.
Click here to learn resources for folks in Vermont to get their homes assessed and tested for lead.
